TextView.android:text: Process of legitimation for those children born out of wedlock under R.A 9255
- Father and Mother\n- Owner of the document
1. PSA Copy of Birth Certificate of the Child/Owner
1. Philippine Statistics Authority or Municipal Civil Registry Office
2. Philippine Statistics Authority or Municipal Civil Registry Office
3. Certificate of no Marriage (CENOMAR) (1 original copy)
3. Philippine Statistics Authority or Municipal Civil Registry Office
4. Attorney or Municipal Civil Registry Office
5. Community Tax Certificate of parents (1 original copy)
5. Barangay Treasurer or Municipal Treasurer's Office
1. Submit requirement to the receiving clerk
1.1. Receive\n\n1.2. Verify the veracity of the requirements.
3. Present the OR to the Receiving Clerk

3.1. Annotate the document.

3.2. Let the Parents Sign the Affidavit of Legitimation

3.3. Present for MCR’s signature.

3.4. Affix seal

3.5. Segregate the accomplished document

3.6. Release the owner’s copy.

3.7. Submit the Documents to PSA, Manila
4.1. Instruct the client to request his/her SECPA.
1. Present the Certificate of Live Birth (COLB) PSA Copy
1.1. Get the legal instrument and office file.\n\n1.2. Verify the Supporting documents
2.1. Process payment and issue Official Receipt
3. Present the OR to the Receiving Clerk

3.1. Annotate the documents

3.2. Present for MCR’s signature.

3.3. Affix seal

3.4. Segregate the accomplished document

3.5. Release the owner’s copy.

3.6. Reendorse the document to PSA, Manila
4.1. Instruct the client to request his/her SECPA.
5. Accomplish Client Satisfactory Survey (CSS) and drop it in the feedback box
5.1. Request Client to accomplish Client Satisfactory Survey (CSS) form in the feedback box
